subject: Re: Splitting class from source
msgSnippet: Thanks for the info regarding successful runs against the .jar.  With all due respect, this is a lot of code to analyze to figure out whether it solves my
messageBody:
Thanks for the info regarding successful runs against the .jar. With
all due respect, this is a lot of code to analyze to figure out
whether it solves my problem, though. Would it be possible to parse
out what you consider the point you intend to make?

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Morten Grum, PH-Consult" <mg@p...>
wrote:
> My tests are compiled independently and run on the *.jar of the src.
>
> Here's one of my build files:
>
> <project name="WaterObjectsModel" default="zipdistfull" basedir=".">
> <description>
> General build file for java projects.
> The project name is used to name jar files, junit reports
and so on.
> Use CreateNewProject.bat to create the permanent folders
and a copy
> of this in the project root.
> </description>
>
> <!-- set global properties for this build -->
> <property name="project.name"
value="WaterObjectsModel"/>
> <property name="test.length" value="short"/>
<!--
> short/long -->
> <property name="javadoc.package"
value="org.waterobjects.*"/>
> <property name="testtorun"
> value="org.waterobjects.AllTests"/>
>
> <!-- set global location properties for this build -->
> <property name="src" location="src"/>
> <property name="lib" location="lib"/>
> <property name="samples" location="samples"/>
> <property name="documentation" location="documentation"/>
> <property name="tests" location="tests"/>
> <property name="testlib" location="testlib"/>
> <property name="testdata" location="testdata"/>
> <property name="testdata.runbasis"
location="${testdata}/runbasis"/>
> <property name="testdata.input"
location="${testdata}/input"/>
> <property name="testdata.change"
location="${testdata}/change"/>
> <property name="testdata.good" location="${testdata}/good"/>
> <property name="testdata.output"
location="${testdata}/output"/>
> <property name="testrun" location="testrun"/>
> <property name="reports" location="reports"/>
> <property name="build" location="build"/>
> <property name="build.srcjar" location="${build}/srcjar"/>
> <property name="build.classes" location="${build}/classes"/>
> <property name="build.dist" location="${build}/dist"/>
> <property name="keystore"
location="${build}/keystore"/>
> <property name="build.javadocs"
location="${build}/javadocs"/>
> <property name="build.testclasses"
location="${build}/testclasses"/>
> <property name="build.testjar" location="${build}/testjar"/>
> <property name="zippeddist" location="zippeddist"/>
> <property name="zippeddistfull" location="zippeddistfull"/>
>
> <path id="libs">
> <fileset dir="${lib}" includes="**/*.jar"/>
> </path>
>
> <path id="testlibs">
> <path refid="libs"/>
> <fileset dir="${testlib}" includes="**/*.jar"/>
> </path>
>
> <target name="init" description="Intialization">
> <!-- Start recording to log -->
> <record name="buildlog.txt" loglevel="info" append="no"/>
> <!-- Create the time stamp -->
> <tstamp/>
> <!-- Define the time stamp dependent properties -->
> <property name="reports.dir"
> location="${reports}/${DSTAMP}${TSTAMP}"/>
> <property name="zippeddist.dir"
location="${zippeddist}"/>
> <property name="zippeddistfull.dir"
location="${zippeddistfull}"/>
> <property name="project.jar"
> location="${build.dist}/${project.name}.jar"/>
> <property name="project.signedjar"
> location="${build.dist}/${project.name}Signed.jar"/>
> </target>
>
> <target name="clean" depends="init" description="Deletes old
> directories">
> <!-- Deletes all directories that are created by this
build.xml -->
> <delete dir="${build}"/>
> <delete dir="${testrun}"/>
> <delete dir="${testdata.output}"/>
> <delete dir="${reports.dir}"/>
> <delete dir="${zippeddist.dir}"/>
> <delete dir="${zippeddistfull.dir}"/>
> <delete>
> <fileset dir=".">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> </delete>
> </target>
>
> <!--
> <mkdir dir="${build.javadocs}"/>
> -->
>
> <target name="compile" depends="clean" description="Compile the
source"
> >
>
> <!-- Create directories -->
> <mkdir dir="${build}"/>
> <mkdir dir="${build.classes}"/>
>
> <!-- Compile the java code -->
> <javac srcdir="${src}" destdir="${build.classes}">
> <classpath refid="libs" />
> </javac>
> </target>
>
> <target name="dist" depends="compile"
> description="Generate the jar file" >
>
> <!-- Create directories -->
> <mkdir dir="${build.dist}"/>
>
> <jar jarfile="${project.jar}" basedir="${build.classes}">
> <include name="**/*.class"/>
> </jar>
> </target>
>
> <target name="genkey" depends="dist"
> description="Genrate an authetification key for the applet">
> <genkey
> alias="PH-Consult"
> keystore="${keystore}"
> keypass="kpi5491chp"
> dname="CN=PH-Consult, O=www.phc.dk, C=DK"
> storepass="p19h45c">
> </genkey>
> </target>
>
> <target name="signjar" depends="genkey"
> description="Sign the jar file for use as applet">
> <signjar
> jar="${project.jar}"
> keystore="${keystore}"
> storepass="p19h45c"
> keypass="kpi5491chp"
> signedjar="${project.signedjar}"
> alias="PH-Consult">
> </signjar>
> </target>
>
> <target name="compiletests" depends="signjar"
> description="Compile the tests " >
>
> <!-- Create directories -->
> <mkdir dir="${build.testclasses}"/>
>
> <javac srcdir="${tests}" destdir="${build.testclasses}">
> <classpath refid="testlibs"/>
> <classpath path="${project.jar}"/>
> </javac>
> </target>
>
> <target name="test" depends="dist,compiletests"
> description="Test the distribution with JUnit" >
>
> <!-- Create directories -->
> <mkdir dir="${testdata.output}"/>
> <mkdir dir="${testrun}"/>
>
> <!-- Copy the change data files that will be changed to the
output
> directory -->
> <copy todir="${testdata.output}">
> <fileset dir="${testdata.change}" includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${testdata.input}" includes="**/*." />
> </copy>
>
> <!-- Copy the change data files that will be changed to the
output
> directory -->
> <copy todir="${testrun}">
> <fileset dir="${testdata.runbasis}" includes="**/*" />
> </copy>
>
> <!-- Run tests with JUnit -->
> <junit fork="on" dir="${build}" showoutput="true">
> <classpath refid="testlibs" />
> <classpath path="${build.testclasses}" />
> <classpath path="${project.jar}" />
> <formatter type="xml" />
> <jvmarg line="-Xss8192k" />
> <test name="${testtorun}" />
> <sysproperty key="user.dir" value="${testrun}"/>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
> <target name="report" depends="test"
> description="Transform test results from xml to html">
>
> <!-- Create directories -->
> <mkdir dir="${reports.dir}"/>
>
> <!-- Copy the XML output to report directory -->
> <copy todir="${reports.dir}">
> <fileset dir=".">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> </copy>
>
> <junitreport todir="${reports.dir}">
> <fileset dir="${reports.dir}">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> <report format="noframes" todir="${reports.dir}"/>
> </junitreport>
> </target>
>
> <target name="javadocs" depends="report"
> description="Generate java docs for the source (excluding
tests)" >
>
> <javadoc sourcepath="${src}\**/*"
destdir="${build.javadocs}">
> <fileset dir="${src}" includes="**/*" />
> <group title="${project.name}"
packages="${javadoc.package}"/>
> </javadoc>
> </target>
>
> <target name="zipdist" depends="report"
> description="Creates a zip file that could be sent
directly to a user.">
>
> <zip destfile="${project.name}${DSTAMP}${TSTAMP}.zip"
filesonly="true">
> <fileset dir="${build.dist}"
includes="**/*" />
> <!-- Is this needed or could external *.jar
files be included in the
> application *.jar -->
> <fileset dir="${lib}" includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${samples}" includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${documentation}"
includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="." includes="*.lnk" />
> <fileset dir="." includes="*.bat" />
> </zip>
> </target>
>
> <target name="srcjar" depends="zipdist"
> description="Generate the jar file of the source java
files" >
>
> <!-- Create directories -->
> <mkdir dir="${build.srcjar}"/>
>
> <jar jarfile="${build.srcjar}\src.jar" basedir="${src}">
> <include name="**/*.java"/>
> </jar>
> </target>
>
> <target name="testjar" depends="srcjar"
> description="Generate the jar file of the test java files" >
>
> <!-- Create directories -->
> <mkdir dir="${build.testjar}"/>
>
> <jar jarfile="${build.testjar}\tests.jar"
basedir="${tests}">
> <include name="**/*.java"/>
> </jar>
> </target>
>
> <target name="zipdistfull" depends="testjar"
> description="Creates a zip file that could be
archived or used by a
> developer.">
> <zip
> destfile="${zippeddistfull.dir}\${project.name}${DSTAMP}${TSTAMP}
_sdk.zip">
> <fileset dir="${build.dist}"
includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${build.srcjar}"
includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${build.testjar}"
includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${build.javadocs}"
includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${lib}" includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${testlib}" includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${samples}" includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${documentation}"
includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="${reports.dir}"
includes="**/*" />
> <fileset dir="." includes="*.lnk" />
> </zip>
> </target>
>
> </project>
>
>
> Regards
> Morten
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: junitguy [mailto:junitguy@y...]
> > Sent: 15. maj 2003 01:55
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] Splitting class from source
> >
> >
> > I keep my source files in a "src" directory. When I build with
Ant,
> > I compile my class files into a "build" directory. I would like
to
> > then run JUnit tests against the newly created classes in the
build
> > directory, but JUnit can't seem to do this unless the .java files
are
> > copied there as well. I've tried setting a classpath to both
> > locations, but this does not solve the problem. Someone have a
good
> > solution to this problem?
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> > junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
> >
> >
> > Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
> >
> >
